I can see the issue now. Looking at the headline template in main.tex, the header box has a height of 9cm (`ht=9cm`) which is quite large. The user is saying it leaves very large margins.

Let me look at the PDF image to confirm this is the issue. Actually, I can see from the web search results that the poster content is there, so the header is working, but it might be too tall causing large margins.

The issue is on line 50:
```latex
\begin{beamercolorbox}[wd=\paperwidth,ht=9cm]{headline}
```

The `ht=9cm` parameter sets the height of the header box to 9cm. For an A0 poster (841mm × 1189mm landscape), 9cm is quite substantial but might leave large margins between the header and the content.

However, looking at the structure more carefully, I think the issue might be the overall vertical alignment. The header is 9cm tall plus 0.3cm for the gold accent line, so about 9.3cm total. On an A0 landscape poster (84.1cm tall), this is about 11% of the height.

Let me reduce the header height and potentially adjust the margins to give more content space. I'll reduce the header height from 9cm to something smaller like 7cm or 6.5cm, and ensure the content starts closer to the header.

Actually, looking at the beamerposter documentation and typical poster layouts, I should also check if there are any top margins being applied. The issue could be:
1. The header height is too large (9cm)
2. There might be implicit margins between the header and content

Let me fix this by:
1. Reducing the header height
2. Adding a negative vspace after the headline or adjusting the frame options

I'll reduce the header to about 7cm and add `vskip=0pt` or adjust the vertical spacing.</details></think>

```diff
+     {\color{AccentGold}\rule{\paperwidth}{0.25cm}}
+   \end{beamercolorbox}
+ }

+ \setbeamertemplate{footline}{}
+

+ \setbeamertemplate{navigation symbols}{}
+ 
```

```diff
- 
+ % Section 1: Background &amp; Motivation
+ \begin{block}{1. Background \&amp; Motivation}
+     \textbf{The Problem:} Bike Sharing Systems (BSS) face two critical challenges:
+     
+     \vspace{0.3cm}
+     \begin{itemize}
+         \item \textbf{Demand-Supply Imbalance:} Stations become empty or full, causing user dissatisfaction
+         \item \textbf{Broken Bikes:} Barcelona: 12\% severe + 55\% light damage; NYC: 2\% need daily repairs
+     \end{itemize}
+     
+     \vspace{0.3cm}
+     \textbf{Research Gap:} No existing study jointly optimizes:
+     \begin{enumerate}
+         \item Vehicle-based repositioning (usable \&amp; broken bikes)
+         \item \textcolor{AlertRed}{\textbf{Labor-based on-site repairs}}
+     \end{enumerate}
+ \end{block}
+ 
```

```diff
+         \item \textbf{MILP Model:} Time-indexed formulation minimizing user dissatisfaction + CO$_2$ emissions
+         \item \textbf{HGSDAC-SBC:} Hybrid Genetic Search algorithm with Station Budget Constraint for large-scale instances
+         \item \textbf{Managerial Insights:} Cost-effectiveness analysis framework for repairer deployment decisions
+     \end{enumerate}
+ \end{block}
```

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: /Users/hurunqiu/trb_poster/sections/sec07_sbc.tex</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 17, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,17 @@
- 
+ % Section 7: Station Budget Concept (SBC)
+ \begin{block}{7. Station Budget Concept (SBC)}
+     \textbf{Key Innovation:} Prevents over-allocation of service time to early stations
+     
+     \vspace{0.3cm}
+     \textbf{Benefit-Cost Ratio Function (BCRF):}
+     \[
+     BCRF_s^t(p,b) = \frac{F_s(p,b) - F_s(q,0)}{t^{load} \cdot (|q-p|+b)}
+     \]
+     
+     \begin{itemize}
+         \item Quantifies dissatisfaction reduction per unit service time
+         \item Higher BCRF stations receive larger time budgets
+         \item Unused time redistributed dynamically to later stations
+     \end{itemize}
+ \end{block}
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+ \begin{block}{10. Cost-Effectiveness of Repairers}
+     \textbf{Indicator $\nu$:} Ratio of dissatisfaction reduction to repairer wage
+     \[
+     \nu = \frac{c^p \sum_{i \in S}(\widehat{F}_i - \widehat{F}'_i)}{\varpi \cdot T / 3600}
+     \]
+     $\nu &gt; 1$: Cost-effective \hspace{1cm} $\nu &lt; 1$: Not cost-effective
+     
+     \vspace{0.3cm}
+     \centering
+     \begin{tabular}{cc}
+         \includegraphics[width=0.48\linewidth]{figures/cost_effectiveness_l10.jpeg} &amp;
+         \includegraphics[width=0.48\linewidth]{figures/cost_effectiveness_l30.jpeg} \\
+         {\small $\ell=10\%$: Never effective} &amp; {\small $\ell=30\%$: Threshold 401s} \\[0.3cm]
+         \includegraphics[width=0.48\linewidth]{figures/cost_effectiveness_l50.jpeg} &amp;
+         \includegraphics[width=0.48\linewidth]{figures/cost_effectiveness_l90.jpeg} \\
+         {\small $\ell=50\%$: Threshold 492s} &amp; {\small $\ell=90\%$: Threshold 580s} \\
+     \end{tabular}
+     
+     \vspace{0.2cm}
+     {\small Higher broken ratio ($\ell$) $\rightarrow$ repairers effective at longer repair times}
+ \end{block}
+ 
```

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: /Users/hurunqiu/trb_poster/sections/sec11_insights.tex</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 10, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,10 @@
- 
+ % Section 11: Key Managerial Insights
+ \begin{block}{11. Key Managerial Insights}
+     \begin{itemize}
+         \item \textcolor{AlertRed}{\textbf{Critical Threshold:}} Repair time $&gt;$ 645s $\Rightarrow$ \textbf{never} cost-effective
+         \item \textbf{Low damage ($\ell &lt; 20\%$):} Trucks alone sufficient; repairers not justified
+         \item \textbf{High damage ($\ell \geq 30\%$):} On-site repairers become economically justified
+         \item \textbf{Preventive maintenance} crucial to keep repair times below threshold
+     \end{itemize}
+ \end{block}
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+ % Section 12: Conclusions
+ \begin{block}{12. Conclusions}
+     \begin{enumerate}
+         \item HGSDAC-SBC is \textbf{scalable} for real-world BSS (up to 500 stations)
+         \item Station Budget Constraint effectively balances time allocation across route
+         \item Dynamic repairer deployment should adapt to daily damage levels
+     \end{enumerate}
+     
+     \vspace{0.3cm}
+     {\small \textbf{Acknowledgments:} NSFC (71771194), RGC Hong Kong (17206322)}
```

```diff
-                 \vspace{0.2cm}
-                 {\small Higher broken ratio ($\ell$) $\rightarrow$ repairers effective at longer repair times}
-             \end{block}
-             
+             \input{sections/sec10_cost_effectiveness}
              \vspace{0.3cm}
  
-             \begin{block}{11. Key Managerial Insights}
-                 \begin{itemize}
-                     \item \textcolor{AlertRed}{\textbf{Critical Threshold:}} Repair time $&gt;$ 645s $\Rightarrow$ \textbf{never} cost-effective
-                     \item \textbf{Low damage ($\ell &lt; 20\%$):} Trucks alone sufficient; repairers not justified
-                     \item \textbf{High damage ($\ell \geq 30\%$):} On-site repairers become economically justified
-                     \item \textbf{Preventive maintenance} crucial to keep repair times below threshold
-                 \end{itemize}
-             \end{block}
- 
+             \input{sections/sec11_insights}
              \vspace{0.3cm}
              
-             \begin{block}{12. Conclusions}
-                 \begin{enumerate}
-                     \item HGSDAC-SBC is \textbf{scalable} for real-world BSS (up to 500 stations)
-                     \item Station Budget Constraint effectively balances time allocation across route
-                     \item Dynamic repairer deployment should adapt to daily damage levels
-                 \end{enumerate}
-                 
-                 \vspace{0.3cm}
-                 {\small \textbf{Acknowledgments:} NSFC (71771194), RGC Hong Kong (17206322)}
-             \end{block}
- 
+             \input{sections/sec12_conclusions}
              \vspace{0.3cm}
  
-             \begin{block}{References}
-                 \small
-                 Hu, R., Szeto, W.Y., \&amp; Ho, S.C. (2025). Repositioning in bike sharing systems with broken bikes considering on-site repairs. \textit{Transportation Research Part E}, 104155.
-                 
-                 \vspace{0.2cm}
-                 \centering
-                 \textbf{Scan for full paper:}\\[0.2cm]
-                 % Placeholder for QR code - you can add actual QR code image
-                 {\Large \texttt{DOI: 10.1016/j.tre.2025.104155}}
-             \end{block}
+             \input{sections/sec13_references}
  
          \end{column}
```

</details>

</tool-use>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The modular structure is now in place. Let me provide a summary to the user.</details></think>

---

Done! The poster is now modularized. Here's the new structure:

```
trb_poster/
├── main.tex                    # Main file (includes all modules)
├── preamble/
│   ├── packages.tex            # Package imports & theme
│   ├── fonts.tex               # Font settings (Helvetica)
│   ├── colors.tex              # Color definitions & beamer settings
│   └── header.tex              # Headline template (title, authors, DOI)
├── sections/
│   ├── sec01_background.tex    # Background & Motivation
│   ├── sec02_contributions.tex # Contributions
│   ├── sec03_problem.tex       # Problem Illustration
│   ├── sec04_model.tex         # Mathematical Model
│   ├── sec05_temporal.tex      # Temporal View
│   ├── sec06_algorithm.tex     # HGSDAC-SBC Algorithm
│   ├── sec07_sbc.tex           # Station Budget Concept
│   ├── sec08_bcrf.tex          # BCRF Illustration
│   ├── sec09_results.tex       # Computational Results
│   ├── sec10_cost_effectiveness.tex  # Cost-Effectiveness
│   ├── sec11_insights.tex      # Key Managerial Insights
│   ├── sec12_conclusions.tex   # Conclusions
│   └── sec13_references.tex    # References
└── figures/                    # All images (unchanged)
```

**How to use:**
- Edit individual section files in `sections/` without affecting others
- Modify colors/fonts in `preamble/` files
- Change header/title in `preamble/header.tex`
- Reorder sections by changing the `\input{}` order in `main.tex`
- To remove a section, just comment out its `\input{}` line

Please recompile `main.tex` to verify everything works correctly.

---
